intro: Comesperma hispidulum, commonly known as the rough comesperma, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
